newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi prince/U.S firm buy Boston's Copley Hotel.
newsitem.headline: Saudi prince/U.S firm buy Boston's Copley Hotel.

text.p: Saudi Arabia's billionaire Prince al-Waleed bin Talal bin Abdulaziz has bought the Copley Plaza Hotel in Boston in partnership with Olympus Real Estate Corporation of the U.S., a statement from the prince's office said on Wednesday.

"In a transaction completed today, a partnership between entities controlled by...Prince al-Waleed...and Olympus Real Estate Corporation of Dallas has acquired the Copley Plaza Hotel in Boston," the statement said.
It said the 379-room, four-star hotel will be managed by San Francisco-based Fairmont Hotel chain, which is 50-percent owned by the prince.
The statement did not say how much the deal was worth.

"A renovation programme, which we plan to commence immediately, will...enhance the value of the property," the statement quoted David Deniger, president and chief executive officer of Olympus Real Estate Corporation.

The deal was the prince's latest acquisition of a hotel. He has substantial investments in Citicorp, Euro Disney SCA, Canary Wharf in London's Docklands, U.S. retail group Saks Fifth Avenue, the Plaza Hotel in New York and the Four Seasons and Fairmont Hotel chains.
